content.description: Sit start matched on a crimp rail. From there, gain a left hand edge, follow to a right hand bump, then move to a right hand sidepull, mantel with the left hand, reach for the rounded lip, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing is good, but there is a boulder behind a portion of the problem.
content.location: It climbs the center of Kiss Blower's southeast face.

content.description: Sit start matched on a large, diagonal rail. From there, gain the rail running counter to the start, follow it to the right, eventually reach a jug, mantel onto the relief, and finish up the easy slab.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good.
content.location: It climbs the north side of Kiss Blower.

content.description:
Pucker Up climbs a short face made of good rock via tricky feet.

Sit start with a right hand edge, a left hand bump-edge, and a good left foot. From there, gain and match on the crimp rail above, find mediocre footing, stick the lip with a big left hand, work to the jug above, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a rock behind the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the north face of Kiss Blower.

content.description: Sit start matched on a jug. From there, gain a right hand edge, bump the left hand along the diagonal rail, reach a right hand sidepull, adjust the feet, reach the edges before the lip, and then mantel on the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there are rocks behind and left of the fall zone.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Kiss Blower.
